trans-unit.source: Retrieves a handle for the standard input, standard output, or standard error device

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves a handle for the standard input, standard output, or standard error device

target.mrk: Retrieves a handle for the standard input, standard output, or standard error device

trans-unit.source: Standard device for which a handle is to be returned. This can be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: Standard device for which a handle is to be returned.
This can be one of the following values:

target.mrk: Standard device for which a handle is to be returned.
This can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: 0 - Handle to the standard input device

seg-source.mrk: 0 - Handle to the standard input device

target.mrk: 0 - Handle to the standard input device

trans-unit.source: 1 - Handle to the standard output device

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Handle to the standard output device

target.mrk: 1 - Handle to the standard output device

trans-unit.source: 2 - Handle to the standard error device

seg-source.mrk: 2 - Handle to the standard error device

target.mrk: 2 - Handle to the standard error device

trans-unit.source: (-1), call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

seg-source.mrk: (-1), call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

target.mrk: (-1), call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

trans-unit.source: The handle has GENERIC_READ and GENERIC_WRITE access rights, unless the application has used SetStdHandle to

target.mrk: The handle has GENERIC_READ and GENERIC_WRITE access rights, unless the application has used SetStdHandle to
